title: Veigar's passive and early game are underwhelming and nearly useless. What if...
body:
Veigar has two major problems right now. The first is the fact that his passive is absolutely awful, not to mention boring and nearly unnoticeable. The second problem is that his early game is abhorrently bad. I mean this guy is a squishy among squishies, a bruised peach among coconuts, soggy bread among a flock of geese. He's **squishy**. Not to mention he's completely immobile and no longer has a reliable stun. _(About the stun, I know it sucks in lane now but it's usable in teamfights and honestly was broken in it's original state)_. This is how I might fix both of those problems at the same time.

What if his passive had something to give it a little kick in the pants? You know, to make it really feel like it's even there. What if Veigar was also given a mini-Morgana passive. 3/6/9% spellvamp. It would be such a small amount that it would take considerable time to heal you up, but would give him sustain in lane without making him harder to kill if you go all in. The recovery would also give you a low level of interaction with the passive, which is better than it just being tacked on there.

His passive is better than it seems, but not noticeable late game.

This ends up being my build late game most of the time.
Rod of Ages gives some decent baseline durability while WotA gives me great sustain late game, and if an assassin jumps me, I can often save myself with the shield from archangel's.

Not saying Veigar doesn't need a buff, though. I'd play him more often if his kit felt at all cohesive

I think you'd get more mileage by dropping the tear item, and getting morello's.  It lacks the small shield, but it has 20% CDR, and much better mana recovery.  Slightly less AP in the grand scheme of things, but AP on items for veigar is more "that's nice" than absolutely required if you are able to Q farm.

With that higher CDR item, you can drop WOTA and get a gunblade (imagine if you will, having almost a second Q that scales with your enormous AP).
